revised_title: The Conversion of Pus into Granulations: A Study on Wound Healing and Regeneration
tldr: The author investigates the transformation of pus into granulations and new flesh, discovering that the coagulation of pus and the extrication of carbonic acid gas play a significant role in the wound healing process. The study also reveals the importance of blood vessels in filling the tubular canals formed by the coagulated pus, connecting to the general circulation and aiding in tissue regeneration.
